snippet: The president’s campaign has decided time on debate preparation is time well spent, even at the cost of voter rallies.
abstract: Pres Obama will spend more time preparing for the second presidential debate than the first, following a poor initial performance; shift will leave the president less time for the voter rallies that tend to showcase his talent for oratory.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and TRIP GABRIEL
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Coral Gables, and Trip Gabriel from Asheville, N.C.

lead_paragraph: The president’s campaign has decided time on debate preparation is time well spent, even at the cost of voter rallies.

headline.seo: Obama Tries to Balance Debate Practice and Rallies
headline.main: After Fiery Florida Rally, Obama Focuses on Debate Work
headline.print_headline: A Fiery Rally, Then More Debate Study for Obama
